cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SSE of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast with landfall expected near the Mississippi-Alabama border, then curving north-northwest over Mississippi and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mouth of the Pearl River / Mississippi-Alabama border

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Shell Beach to the Mouth of the Mississippi River, and east of Dauphin Island to Navarre
weather_observation.warning_coast: West of the Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (sustained 30–40 mph, gusts near 50 mph) possible late Tuesday through early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible along the lower Mississippi River delta and Plaquemines Parish coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 2–4 inches; localized flooding possible but widespread 4-inch totals unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and a low tornado risk in squalls.
